Both have made mistakes or faced setbacks; Saeng failed the test, and the hibiscus was confined to a pot. However, they are both going to transform these negative situations.

In Minfong Ho's "Winter Hibiscus," the author concludes the paragraph in such a manner to convey the determination and newly - found motivation that Saeng gains from buying the familiar plant. Despite failing her test, the discovery of a plant that reminded her of home and her grandmother instilled in her the motivation to retake the test. She was resolved to make her new life in the new country better, regardless of the circumstances. The author's inclusion of details about the geese, such as "She lifted her head and watched as their distinctive u was etched against the evening sky...", represents the concept of moving on. Just as the geese go and return, Saeng failed the test once but was motivated to try again after getting the plant and seeing the birds. The statement "Almost reluctantly she realized that many of the things that she thought of as strange before had become... familiar to her" shows that the geese, among other things, had become familiar in her new home. Concluding the story with a mention of the geese indicates that Saeng is gradually learning to adapt to her unfamiliar new home. The plant, being familiar to her, provided comfort. As described, "Saeng felt a shock of recognition so intense, it was almost visceral. 'Dok malik,' Saeng said." After failing her driver's test, entering the florist's shop and finding the plant made the new place feel more like home. The geese became familiar over time, and the plant offered comfort. In the story "Winter Hibiscus" by Minfong Ho, the author concludes with the line "when they come back, Saeng vowed silently to herself, in the spring, when the snows melt and the geese return and this hibiscus is budding, then I will take that test again". The return of the geese, the melting of the snow, and the budding of the hibiscus all symbolize a new beginning. In "Winter Hibiscus", the author concludes the story in a way related to Saeng's experience of failing her driving test. Saeng shed tears upon seeing a flower that reminded her of her past. The author concludes the story with a paragraph to illustrate Saeng's determination. Saeng's declaration that she will take the test again clearly shows her resolve. Even though she failed her driver's test, she is not willing to give up, which further emphasizes her determined nature.

In the short story “Winter Hibiscus” penned by Minfong Ho, the main character Saeng concludes the narrative by promising herself that in spring, when the geese return and the winter hibiscus begins to bud, she will retake the failed driver's test. The hibiscus from the floral shop serves as a connection for Saeng to her homeland, while the bitter melon, beloved by Saeng but unpalatable to the people in @LOCATION1, represents her struggle to connect with the locals. The author of the story "Winter Hibiscus" concludes the narrative with a statement that when Saeng's hibiscus first buds in the spring, she will return to take the driver's test. The story concludes with this line because Saeng draws strength from the hibiscus. As a result, the next time she takes the driver's test, she will not fail. By encountering these plants again, especially the hibiscus, she can draw strength from those memories. However, these memories also bring deep sadness, as described in the story: "A wave of loss so deep and strong that it stung Saeng's eyes now swept over her" (Ho). Experiencing this sadness will only make her stronger. Moreover, beyond the sight of the hibiscus, other factors will also prepare her for the test. The story mentions, "It felt smooth and cool, with a hint of velvet towards the center – just as she had known it would feel" (Ho). The texture of the hibiscus in that month reminds Saeng of distant memories, such as helping her grandmother with her hair. All these experiences will strengthen Saeng, ensuring that she will pass the test on her next attempt.

The author concludes the story with this paragraph as it reveals what Saeng will do and whether she will attend school. The author concludes the story with the quote “When they come back, Saeng vowed silently to herself, in the spring, when the snows melt and the geese return and this hibiscus is budding, then I will take that test again.” This is because the author aims to show that nature and the plant hold value for Saeng. At the end of the story, the girl Saeng vows to herself that she will take the driver's test next year. One reason for this vow is to prove that she can pass the test. The author includes this paragraph to bring an end to the story and to demonstrate that Saeng has not given up. The author concludes the story with this paragraph to demonstrate that Saeng did not abandon the idea of taking the test. At the conclusion of "Winter Hibiscus," author Minfong Ho ends the story by having Saeng vow silently, “when they come back, in the spring, when the snow melts and the geese return and this hibiscus is budding, then I will take the test again.” The author chooses this ending to reveal the hope that awaits Saeng in the future. The reason the author concludes the story with this paragraph is that the entire story revolves around a girl missing her home country. The author concludes the story with the line “when they come back, Saeng vowed silently to herself, in the spring, when the snows melt and the geese return and this hibiscus is budding, then I will take that test again”. By stating “I will take that test again”, the author prompts the reader to question whether Saeng will pass the test next time and to wonder what “the test” actually is.

The author concludes the story with this paragraph possibly because she doesn't want the snow to melt, so that the geese won't return. Moreover, I think it aims to inform the reader about Saeng's thoughts.

The author concluded the story with that quote for a specific reason. The author intended to illustrate how the plant instilled a new sense of determination in Saeng. Previously, Saeng was upset and tearing the plant apart. However, it appears that she realized how the plant was able to bud against the odds and survive. As a result, she is now determined to face the odds as well and retake the test she failed.
